project_name.description: The name of the build project.

branch_filter.description: A regular expression used to determine which branches get built. Default is all branches are built. It is recommended to use `filter_group` over `branch_filter`.

filter_group.description: Information about the webhook's trigger. Filter group blocks are documented below.

filter.description: A webhook filter for the group. Filter blocks are documented below.

type.description: The webhook filter group's type. Valid values for this parameter are: `EVENT`, `BASE_REF`, `HEAD_REF`, `ACTOR_ACCOUNT_ID`, `FILE_PATH`. At least one filter group must specify `EVENT` as its type.

pattern.description: For a filter that uses `EVENT` type, a comma-separated string that specifies one event: `PUSH`, `PULL_REQUEST_CREATED`, `PULL_REQUEST_UPDATED`, `PULL_REQUEST_REOPENED`. `PULL_REQUEST_MERGED` works with GitHub & GitHub Enterprise only. For a filter that uses any of the other filter types, a regular expression.

exclude_matched_pattern.description: If set to `true`, the specified filter does *not* trigger a build. Defaults to `false`.

id.description: The name of the build project.

payload_url.description: The CodeBuild endpoint where webhook events are sent.

secret.description: The secret token of the associated repository. Not returned by the CodeBuild API for all source types.
